resources.string: MEATER Cloud is connected to your Facebook Account.
MEATER Cloud is connected to your Google Account.
Are you sure you want to delete your account?
Deleting your account will remove all information about you from MEATER Cloud.
You will not be able to login to MEATER Cloud without creating a new account.
About Custom Ambient and Internal Alerts
An amount of time has elapsed
Please add your MEATER devices in order to use the MEATER Cloud.
Add a password to your MEATER Cloud account
Starting in August 2019, we removed support for signing in to MEATER Cloud using your Google or Facebook account.
Why did we make this change?
To retain access to MEATER Cloud, you simply need to add a password to your account.
You\'ll need this to sign in to MEATER Cloud on another phone or tablet.
We’ve just sent an email to
To retain access to MEATER Cloud, tap on the link in the email.
This link will let you add a password to your MEATER Cloud account – you can use this password to sign in with the MEATER app.
Keep me in the loop with all things MEATER!
Alert me when the ambient temperature falls below…
Alert me when the ambient temperature rises above…
Alert me when the internal temperature falls below…
Alert me when the internal temperature rises above…
This MEATER Cloud account is connected to your Facebook account.
This MEATER Cloud account is connect to your Google or Facebook account.
This MEATER Cloud account is connect to your Facebook account.
The MEATER Cloud account is connected to your Google account.
MEATER is unable to update the software on your Amber because the battery level is low.
To update your Amber, change the battery.

WARNING: Ambient temperature (%s) is above safe level!
Are you sure you want to cancel?
Are you sure, you wish to continue?
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this note?
Are you sure you want to start a cook with this %s?
By default, MEATER will prompt you when it finds a nearby MEATER device that isn‘t already paired.
If you turn this off, you can pair with MEATER devices manually from the \'Add and Remove Devices\' screen.
MEATER found a new device nearby: %s Would you like to pair with this device?
Pop off the back panel and pull out the battery tab
Please be aware, developer mode is enabled on this device.
Some developer mode settings may affect connectivity to your MEATER devices.
Before updating, ensure both this device and your %s are next to each other to ensure a good connection.
We suspect there is an issue with this device\'s Bluetooth. Please restart your device if the problem persists.
To set up WiFi for a MEATER Block, Bluetooth must be enabled on this device.
Standalone mode lets you set up cooks directly on your MEATER Block. WiFi mode lets you set up and track your cooks on your phone or tablet.
For now, let\'s set up your MEATER Block to connect to WiFi.
More information about Standalone mode is available in the MEATER app\'s build–in–help.
Your MEATER Block connected to the WiFi network, but the MEATER app is unable to communicate with it over WiFi.
Your MEATER Block is connected to WiFi, but the MEATER app is unable to communicate with it.
Your MEATER Block\'s batteries are empty. It will shut down shortly.
Your MEATER Block is having trouble downloading the update software. Please ensure both this device and your Block are close to your WiFi router, and try again.
This MEATER Block is connected to the WiFi network:
You can now track cooks with your MEATER Block probes over your WiFi network using MEATER Link.
Update your MEATER Block to improve performance and reliability.
Before updating, ensure both this device and your Block are close to your WiFi router to ensure a good connection.
Updating usually takes a few minutes. Interrupting the update process may damage your Block, so please do not turn off your Block or quit the MEATER app on this device until the update completes.
To begin the update process, tap the \'Start Update\' button below.
Your MEATER Block has successfully downloaded the software update, and will now automatically install it.

The update process can take a couple of minutes, and your Block may restart several times. Please don\'t turn off your MEATER Block during the update process. The Block\'s display will show the list of probes when the update is complete.
MEATER Block has successfully connected to the WiFi Network
Your MEATER Block appears to be having trouble establishing an IP Address. Please check your network settings or contact support for further assistance.
MEATER Block is attempting to connect to the WiFi Network:
Your MEATER Block is downloading the Firmware update.
MEATER is unable to update the software on your MEATER Block because the battery level is low. To update your MEATER Block, change the batteries or plug it into power.
MEATER Block is low on battery
Your MEATER Block is currently on low power. Please ensure you change the batteries or connect a USB power source before starting a cook.
MEATER was unable to test connectivity to your Block because it is not connected to any probes.
Connect probes to your MEATER Block
The MEATER app is having trouble communicating with your MEATER Block. Please check your network settings or contact support for further assistance.
Power on the Block and select “Use WiFi” (On the first use, it will start in WiFi mode automatically)
This MEATER Block is currently configured to connect to the WiFi network:
This MEATER Block has not been set up to connect to WiFi yet.
To connect your MEATER Block to a different WiFi network, tap \'Configure WiFi\'.
To connect your MEATER Block to a WiFi network, tap \'Configure WiFi\'.
Using your Block in WiFi Mode
MEATER Block supports two modes: WiFi, and standalone.
This password is too long for use with MEATER Block.

HOW DO I CONNECT TO MY DEVICE?
Tap on a device to connect to it.
Below are the MEATER devices you have previously connected to, and any other MEATER devices nearby. Tap a nearby devices to pair with it, or swipe from right to left on a paired devices to remove it.
When you’ve connected to all the devices you want, tap next to continue setup.
Note: You can add more devices later via Settings.
To connect to a MEATER probe, remove it from the charging station.
To connect to a new MEATER probe attached to another phone, tablet or MEATER Block, make sure you are on the same WiFi network as that device.
Please ensure both this device and your %s are close to your WiFi router, and try again.

Some devices require Location tracking to be enabled for MEATER to discover nearby probes. Please enable Location tracking in your device\'s settings.

Update your MEATER Plus to improve performance and reliability.
Before updating, ensure both this device and your MEATER Plus are next to each other to ensure a good connection.

Updating usually takes 8–10 minutes. Interrupting the update process may damage your MEATER Plus, so please do not put the MEATER probe back into the MEATER Plus base station or quit the MEATER app on this device until the update completes.
To begin the update process, tap the ‘Start Update’ button below.

How to insert your MEATER probe
Insert your MEATER probe into the middle of the thickest part of the meat.
If possible, ensure the portion up to the arrow is inside the meat.
The groove on the device must be fully inside the meat. Failing to insert the MEATER probe correctly can damage the MEATER device.

This probe will not function correctly with your MEATER Plus. If your MEATER Plus came with a probe, use that probe instead. If you want to cook with this probe, remove the battery from the MEATER Plus and pair with this probe directly.
This probe is not compatible with MEATER Plus

When alerted, remove the meat from heat and rest uncovered on a cool surface
Add colour and flavour with high heat
If you want to sear your meat, twist and pull the probe out first
Please review the safety information for your MEATER

DO NOT remove the probe while it is exposed to heat. The probe must be inserted in and removed from meat away from all heat sources.

DO NOT allow the probe to come in direct contact with hot charcoal or coals.

If the probe falls into the coals, DO NOT try to retrieve it immediately. Close the lid and vents of the grill and allow the probe to cool completely before removing.

Always use eye protection when removing a probe that has exceeded the maximum temperature or come in contact with hot charcoals or direct flames.
Read the following safety information before continuing your cook setup. Failure to follow the warnings below may lead to serious injury:
Sorry we cannot find what you are looking for. Please try searching for something else.
You don\'t currently have any devices available.
Lets you know that MEATER is running in the background
Alternatively, you can set up another product if you have one:
When enabled, MEATER Link lets you share MEATER probes between multiple devices.
Devices on the same WiFi network will automatically connect to each other, allowing you to set up and monitor cooks for any nearby MEATER probe.
MEATER Link is required when using a MEATER Block.
Requires MEATER Link to be enabled.

When MEATER Cloud Sharing is enabled, this device will send temperature information to the MEATER Cloud. Other devices will be able to monitor MEATER probes from anywhere an Internet connection is available.
Note: this device must remain in tracking range of the MEATER probes for MEATER Cloud Sharing to operate.
When enabled, MEATER app will keep your device’s screen turned on while a cook is in progress, though you can still turn it off manually.
Using this setting will use more battery power, so we recommend you keep this device plugged in and charging during a long cook.

By default, probes that came with your MEATER Block are only available when you are paired with a Block that has been configured to use WiFi. Turn this option on and this device can pair with individual MEATER Block probes directly, even when the Block is switched off.
Use this setting if you want to use the probes that came with your MEATER Block separately from the Block itself.
When enabled, notifications that appear in the MEATER app about changes to your cook state or custom alerts will disappear after 10 seconds.
If not enabled, these notification messages will remain on–screen, and will continue to play sound and/or vibrate your device until you dismiss them.
Notify Me 5 Mins Before Cook Ends
When enabled, MEATER will automatically notify you when around 5 minutes of cooking time remain.
A MEATER Cloud account is required for sharing cook. Sign in to MEATER Cloud, or sign up for an account (it\'s free) on the Setting screen to share this cook.

The device with a direct connection to this probe is not connected to MEATER Cloud. To use the cook sharing feature, make sure all your devices are using the latest version of the MEATER software and are configured to use MEATER Cloud.
MEATER Cloud is currently disabled. Please re–enable MEATER Cloud support in the Settings screen to share this cook.
Share your cooks on the web
Would you like to share your graph or a photo?
With the Share Cook feature, you can track your cook in real time on your Mac, Windows PC or any other device with the web browser.
View your cook on a big screen TV, or share it with friends online. You can even track your cook on another mobile device without the MEATER app installed!
Enter your email address to sign in to MEATER Cloud.
If you don\'t have a MEATER Cloud account yet, no problem! Just enter your email address, and you can set one up on the next screen.

The account you are attempting to sign in with was registered using Google. This device unfortunately does not support Google Play Services and as such cannot sign in using this method. Please sign in using Facebook or via email with an account not associated with Google Play Services.

MEATER Block supports two modes: WiFi and Standalone. Standalone Mode allows you to cook without the need for a phone or tablet.
You\'ll also be able to see the estimated time remaining when MEATER has enough information to calculate an estimate.
Your block will automatically alert you 5 minutes before your cook is likely to end…
And again, when it’s time to take your meat or fish out of your oven, grill, smoker or pan.
Select ‘Standalone’ to use your block in Standalone mode.
MEATER Block will connect to its probes…
To start a cook with the selected probe, tap the %s button.
First, choose the meat you want to cook.
Finally, select how the desired done–ness.
MEATER Block will show you a visual indication of how much time your cook has remaining.
Touch the left and right arrows to see the target, ambient and internal temperatures.
Cook without using your smart device
Use the Block screen and touchpad to set up and monitor your cook

Update your %s to improve performance and reliability.
Updating usually takes 8–10 minutes. Interrupting the update process may damage your %s, so please do not put the MEATER probe back into its charger or quit the MEATER app until the update completes.

The temperatures marked with USDA–safe icon indicates the compliance with The United States Department of Agriculture which recommends an internal temperature of at least 145 °F (63 °C) for cuts of beef, veal, and lamb in order to prevent foodborne illness, and warns that colour and texture indicators are not reliable. The same meats should be thoroughly cooked to 160°F (71 °C) when ground or tenderized by cutting, since these processes distribute bacteria throughout the meat.
